title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: Then I rode over Lanark Moor to Hyndford and through the moorof Carmichael and under the great shadow of Tintock.

title: Salute to Adventurers
author: Buchan, John
snippet: When I crossed Clydeby the bridge at Hyndford the water was swirling up to the key-stone.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The eastraost house in this row, which adjoins the Assembly Hall, was built by Robert Mowbray of Castlewan in 1740, on the site of an ancient mansion which belonged to the Countess Dowager of Hyndford.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the opposite bank of the river is Brownlee (Harvie, Esq.), and more up the Clyde, the stately mansion of Mauldslie Castle (James Hozier, Esq.), formerly the seat of the Earls of Hyndford.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: The scenery of his patrimonial inheritance was sketched from that of Carmichael, the ancient and now deserted mansion of the noble family of Hyndford ; but for his strongly Scottish feelings about parting with his land, and stern efforts to suppress them, the author had not to go so far a-field.

title: Romances of the old town of Edinburgh /
author: Leighton, Alexander
snippet: With which help you may be induced to represent  to yourself, as vividly as the fervour of your imagination may enable you, the house in Hyndford' s Close, which, at the time wherein we are concerned, was occupied by a retired advocate called Mr George Plenderleith.

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: As a boy Scott was fond of the precincts of Hyndford' s Close (50 High Street) — of which some of the old houses are still left — for here lived his mother's brother, Dr. Daniel Rutherford ; and as a man in 1 8 19 he bade farewell to his mother at 75 George Street, now a shop, and carried her therefrom to St.

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: As a boy Scott was fond of the precincts of Hyndford's Close (50 High Street)——of which some of theold houses are still left—for here lived his mother'sbrother, Dr. Daniel Rutherford; and as a man inI819 he bade farewell to his mother at 75 GeorgeStreet, now a shop, and carried her therefrom to St.John's Church, at the west end of Princes Street,where she lies in an unmarked and unknown grave.

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: He received Stuart kindly, inquired after many of his old friends,opened his eyes widely at what he called the audacity of the brigandsin detaining a British officer, read attentively the letters of Alvaro andHyndford, appeared to take great interest in the affair, and gave theominous official promise ' to see what could be done.'

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: With a thousand prayers for yoursafety, and a thousand more for your return, I must now conclude, aspapa and Hyndford have just come from the moors, with six men ladenwith grouse-bags, and I must hurry down to the drawing-room.

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: of Lysle, and Hyndford, who is one of our representative peers, is usingall his interest for him in the Upper House.
